content.question: For time <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>, four particles—<math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>—move along parallel horizontal lines in the <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate of the position of each particle is <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graphs of the velocity of each particle, in meters per second, are shown below. Which is the graph of the velocity of the particle that is farthest to the right at time <math alttext="t equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The graph is labeled “Velocity of Particle A.” The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled v sub A, of t, and the numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins at a local maximum on the vertical axis at 1, and moves downward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis at approximately 0.7, and reaches a minimum at the point with coordinates 2 comma negative 3. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at approximately 3.3, and reaches a local maximum at the point with coordinates 4 comma 1.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The graph is labeled Velocity of Particle B. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled v sub B, of t, and the numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated. The line begins on the vertical axis at 1, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 4 comma 1.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The graph is labeled Velocity of Particle C. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled v sub C, of t, and the numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward to the right until it reaches a maximum at the point with coordinates 1 comma 1. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at 2, and reaches a minimum at the point with coordinates 3 comma negative 1. The curve then moves upward and to the right until it ends on the x axis at 4.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The graph is labeled Velocity of Particle D. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled v sub D, of t, and the numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at the point with coordinates 0 comma negative 1, and moves upward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis at approximately 0.3, and continues upward until it reaches a maximum at the point with coordinates 2 comma 3. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis at 4.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The graph is labeled Velocity of Particle D. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled v sub D, of t, and the numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at the point with coordinates 0 comma negative 1, and moves upward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis at approximately 0.3, and continues upward until it reaches a maximum at the point with coordinates 2 comma 3. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis at 4.
